entities.description: The unlawful killing of a human being without malice.
The killing of another person through gross negligence.
The killing of a felon by a peace officer in the line of duty or the killing during the commission of a felony by a private citizen.
The unlawful seizure, transportation, and/or detention of a person against their will.
The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim.
Oral or anal sexual intercourse with another person, without the consent of the victim.
The use of an object or instrument to unlawfully penetrate, however slightly, the genital or anal opening of the body of another person, without the consent of the victim.
The touching of the private body parts of another person for the purpose of sexual gratification, without the consent of the victim.
The taking, or attempting to take, anything of value from the care, custody, or control of a person or persons by force or threat of force or violence and/or by putting the victim in fear.
An unlawful attack by one person upon another for the purpose of inflicting severe or aggravated bodily injury.
An unlawful physical attack by one person upon another where neither the offender displays a weapon, nor the victim suffers obvious severe or aggravated bodily injury.

Unlawfully placing another person in reasonable fear of bodily harm through the use of threatening words and/or other conduct, without displaying a weapon or subjecting the victim to actual physical attack.
Any willful or malicious burning or attempt to burn, with or without intent to defraud, a dwelling house, public building, motor vehicle or aircraft, personal property of another, etc.
To unlawfully obtain money, property, or any other thing of value, either tangible or intangible, through the use of threat or coercion.
The unlawful entry into a building or other structure with the intent to commit a felony or a theft.
Theft of articles from another person's physical possession by stealth.
The grabbing or snatching of a purse or handbag from the physical possession of another person.
The theft, by someone other than an employee of the victim, of goods or merchandise exposed for sale.
A theft from within a building which is either open to the general public or where the offender has legal access.
A theft from a machine or device which is operated or activated by the use of coins.
The theft of articles from a motor vehicle, whether locked or unlocked.
The theft of any part or accessory attached to the interior or exterior of a motor vehicle in a manner which would make the part difficult to remove.
All thefts which do not fit the definition of any of the specific subcategories of Larceny/Theft.
The theft or attempted theft of a motor vehicle.

The altering, copying, or imitation of something, without authority or right, with the intent to deceive or defraud by passing the copy or thing altered or imitated as that which was original or genuine.
The intentional misrepresentation of existing fact or condition, or the use of some other deceptive scheme or device, to obtain money, goods, or other things of value.
The unlawful use of a credit/debit card or automated teller machine for fraudulent purposes.

Falsely representing one's identity or position, and acting in the character or position thus unlawfully assumed, to deceive others and thereby gain a benefit or advantage, or to cause a benefit or advantage to be conferred on another.

relationships.description: Murder/nonnegligent manslaughter is a type of crime.
Negligent manslaughter is a type of crime.
Justifiable homicide is a type of crime.
Kidnapping or abduction is a type of crime.
Rape is a type of crime.
Sodomy is a type of crime.
Sexual assault with an object is a type of crime.
Fondling is a type of crime.
Robbery is a type of crime.
Aggravated assault is a type of crime.
Simple assault is a type of crime.
Intimidation is a type of crime.
Arson is a type of crime.
Extortion or blackmail is a type of crime.
Burglary or breaking and entering is a type of crime.
Pocket-picking is a type of crime.
Purse-snatching is a type of crime.
Shoplifting is a type of crime.
Theft from building is a type of crime.
Theft from coin-operated machine or device is a type of crime.
Theft from motor vehicle is a type of crime.
Theft of motor vehicle parts or accessories is a type of crime.
All other larceny is a type of crime.
Motor vehicle theft is a type of crime.
Counterfeiting or forgery is a type of crime.
False pretenses, swindle, or confidence game is a type of crime.
Credit card or automatic teller machine fraud is a type of crime.
Impersonation is a type of crime.
